alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 2:21PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, southern Nash, southwestern Wilson and northeastern Johnston Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 221 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Smithfield, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fremont, Bailey, Micro, Selma, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Lucama, Black Creek and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
